intro: Melanortocarya, commonly known as the blackleaf spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive dark green to blackish leaves, which are typically lance-shaped and have a waxy texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in structures called cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Melanortocarya is native to parts of Africa and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. It is known for its toxic sap, which can cause skin irritation and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
